intro: Crepis bannatica, commonly known as the Bannat's hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. Crepis bannatica is often found in high-altitude environments, where it adapts to cold and harsh climatic conditions.
